description.narrative: 1. % of Households in designated target areas sprayed by indoor residual spraying in the last 12 months; 2. Number of Impregnated Long Lasting Bednet distributed 3. Percentage of confirmed malaria cases (uncomplicated and severe) that received first line and other recommended antimalarial drugs according to national policy in both the health centres and community level. 4. Percentage of people who know the causes, symptoms, treatment and preventive measures for malaria

comment.narrative: The following baseline data was used for the second phase of the project (2013-2015): 1. In 2012, 29 740 out of 35 874 households in designated target areas, i.e. 82.9% were sprayed by indoor residual spraying in the last 12 months 2. In 2012, 108 128 long lasting bednets (LLINs) were distributed 3. In 2012, 12 275 confirmed malaria cases (uncomplicated and severe) received first line and other recommended antimalarial drug according to national policy in both the health centres and community level. 4. There was no baseline date for the percentage of people who know the cause of, symptoms of, treatment for, or preventive measures of malaria

1. Households in designated target areas sprayed by indoor residual spraying in the last 12 months (Number and percentage) 2. Number of long lasting bednets (LLINs) distributed 3. Percentage of confirmed malaria cases (uncomplicated and severe) that received first line and other recommended antimalarial drug according to national policy in both the health centres and community level. 4. Percentage of people who know the causes, symptoms of, treatment and preventive measures for malaria
Results for the first semester of 2015 will be available in August 2015 whereas the results for the year 2015 will be available in February 2016.

description.narrative: Number of women recieving test and counselling services; Number of sex workers through community outreach with at least one HIV information, education and communication or behaviour change communication; Number of people with advanced HIV+ infection receiving ARV treatement (second line) according to national guidelines.

comment.narrative: 2770 women recieving test and counselling services for HIV and their results;54 sex workers reached trhough community outreach with at least one HIv information, education, communication and behaviour change communication; Number of people with advanced HIV+ infection recieving ARv treatement (second line) according to national guidelines.

13560 women received testing and counseling services for HIV and received their test results. 70 sex workers (i.e. 59% were reached through community outreach with at least one HIV information, education, communication or behavior change communication. 38 people with advanced HIV+ infection (i.e. 60%) received ARV treatment (second line) according to national guidelines
The first semester of 2015 results will be available in August 2015 whereas the 2015 annual results will be available in February 2016.

Strengthening climate information and early warning systems in Western and Central Africa for climate resilient development and adaptation to climate change – São Tomé and Príncipe

Number of preparedness plans that cover response AND recovery
PIMS 5103-STRENGTHENING CLIMATES
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

receiver-org.narrative: Government of Sao Tome and Principe

description.narrative: To strengthen the climate monitoring capabilities early warning systems and available information for responding to climate shocks and planning adaptation to climate change in São Tomé and Principe

1Capacity as per capacity assessment scorecard
2Domestic finance committed to the relevant institutions to monitor extreme weather and climate change

comment.narrative:
1Limited capacity to generate EWS and CI on a national scale for extreme hydrometeorological phenomena
Limited disaster risk prevention capacity on local levels within CONPREC CP
No Standard Operating Procedure SOP for alert communication by CONPREC CP with the support of NGOsCSOs
Current score 22
2Existing budget plans do not have sufficient funds to maintain and operate environmental monitoring infrastructure
Current budget 500000

1 Capacity assessment Target score 161 for all combined EWS agencies
2 30 increase in domestic financing for equipment operation and maintenance across all institutions

A contest was launched and a company was selected to provide hydrometeorological equipment The process was evaluated at the regional level
A working meeting with telecommunications companies was organized So far just CST Santomean Company of telecommunication met with us and we are still waiting for another meeting to happen with UNITEL ST
A field visit to the district level was made and 10 new local committees for risk management and disasters have been created
Training of 26 journalists and 3 meteorological technicians in Environmental Journalism and disaster risk management through the South South cooperation Training of 44 technicians from district chambers regional government and NGOs on Capacity Building of Local and Regional Authorities in the Implementation of Programs and Development Projects

description.narrative: Efficient and effective use of hydrometeorological and environmental information for making early warnings and longterm development plans

1 of population with access to improved climate information and flood drought strong wind and coastal warnings disaggregated by gender
2 GoSTP Development Plans and landuse plans at National District that integrate climate information in their formulation of poverty reduction strategies and links between poverty and the environment at local levels
3Sectorspecific EW products and strategies that integrate climate risks in fisheries tourism and land management sectors

comment.narrative:
1 There are existing EWS initiatives for regional drought and famine alerts however a national alert system concerned with extreme hydrometeorological phenomena is not available There is a limited understanding of technical alert jargon alerts are not translated into national languages No mechanism exists for most vulnerable populations to be involved in the alert process to ensure its sustainability
Current access to warnings 30 men 20 women
2Development frameworks do not incorporate any EWSCI products such as risk maps or climate change predictions into longterm planning
Current score 0
3 Sector specific strategies do not include EWSCI because the quality of weather forecasts and climate predictions is poor and not tailored for specific uses particularly seasonal forecasts
Current score 0

1 Increase to 50 for both men and women who have access to improved EWSCI
Target 50 men 50 women
2 At least 2 of the PRSP policy briefs incorporate analyses of risk maps andor climate change projections influencing longterm planning proposals at least 1 national and 1 district plan
Target score 2
3 Development of at least 2 tailored climate products and presentation of a market research plan on how to implement mobile phone based fishing and agricultural advisories both supporting targeted weatherclimate service delivery
Target score 2

Creation of the terms of reference to select 10 meteorological observers
The project was presented in the Autonomous Region of Principe to the Regional President of the government Regional Secretary of Infrastructure and the Regional Direction of Meteorology and Natural Resources and Energy
Identification of hydrologic and meteorological resources in the Autonomous Region
It is scheduled for next year to undergo the acquisition of the proper ways to transfer data and give the possibility to share realtime climate information with fisherman and farmers using SMS
It is also planned to launch a ToR to recruit a national consultant to make the inventory of all the possible private buyers for meteorological information and the establishment of partnerships with them
A local committee for natural disasters and risk management with a proper training plan was created

description.narrative: Enhanced capacity of national hydrometeorological NHMS and environmental institutions to monitor extreme weather and climate change

1 national coverage of climateweather and hydrological monitoring infrastructure
2Frequency and timeliness of climaterelated data availability

comment.narrative:
1Currently there is less than 20 national coverage for climateweather monitoring with respect to the optimal arrangements defined in NIMDGRNE feasibility reports and WMO standards
Baseline is 7 AWS 2 Automatic water level stations and 58 manual synoptic agro hydrometric stations needing upgrades
2Data from manual weather and hydrological stations is collected monthly and transmitted by post

1 Increase to 60 national coverage to take steps in achieving NHMS optimal monitoring arrangements as defined in feasibility studies
Target 31 AWS 14 automatic water level stations and 58 manual synoptic agro hydrometric stations upgraded
2 Target for data transmission frequency daily

Recruitment of a consultant to assess the acquisition and installation of a lightning detection system based on the updated system under SINERGIA
Recruitment of a national consultant to make the baseline of the meteorological and hydrological sector and all the others partner involved in this project
Elaboration of a training plan for meteorologists and meteorological observers hydrologists and hydrological observers International and regional institutions have been contacted for the training of meteorologists and hydrologists We have already selected the candidates and we are waiting for the last confirmations from universities to send the students

description.narrative: 1-Number of notified cases of all forms of TB-bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse. 2-Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapse.

comment.narrative: 147 TB cases (all forms) notified. Out of this, 80 bacteriologically confirmed TB cases notified. Baseline year is 2013
157 TB cases (all forms); 87 TB bacteriologically confirmed TB cases

79 TB cases all forms were reported (until June 2015) 32 bacteriologically confirmed TB cases were reported (until June 2015) [THE DATA FROM THE ALL YEAR 2015 WILL BE REPORTED, BY THE NATIONAL AUTHORITY, ON THE FIRST TRIMESTER 2016]
